newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - May 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - May 23.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Friday:
* The United States' first female B-52 pilot has accepted an offer of a general discharge rather than endure a court-martial for adultery, lying and other charges.
* Russian President Boris Yeltsin dismissed his top defense aides for resisting spending cuts and military reforms.
* A new federal jail in Brooklyn, N.Y., was turned into a Mafia social club straight out of "Goodfellas" -- complete with haute cuisine -- by corrupt guards, federal officials said.
* Two Chinese companies have been hit with sanctions by the United States, which has accused them of knowingly helping Iran make chemical weapons.
* Lawyers for accused Oklahoma City bomber Timothy McVeigh began presenting the defense case.
* A soft-spoken cleric has emerged as a top candidate among Iranians seeking political change.

* A controversy has arisen over patent royalties paid to a company headed by the doctor who found a relationship in tests of pregnant women between levels of a frequently checked hormone and the incidence of Down Syndrome.
